Class program.commands.CommandReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • program.commands.CommandReader

  • public class program.commands.CommandReader
extends java.lang.Object
    The Command Reader class. It is meant to scan inputs and parse them into commands

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      program.commands.CommandReader(java.util.Date date, java.util.LinkedList<additionals.SpaceMarine> collection, java.util.LinkedList<additionals.Chapter> chapters, java.lang.String file)
      Constructor for instantiating a new Command reader to use the System.in as input.
      program.commands.CommandReader(java.util.Date date, java.util.LinkedList<additionals.SpaceMarine> collection, java.util.LinkedList<additionals.Chapter> chapters, java.lang.String file, java.lang.String script, int marker)
      Constructor for instantiating a new Command reader to use the script-file as input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • program.commands.CommandReader

        public program.commands.CommandReader(java.util.Date date,
                     java.util.LinkedList<additionals.SpaceMarine> collection,
                     java.util.LinkedList<additionals.Chapter> chapters,
                     java.lang.String file)
        Constructor for instantiating a new Command reader to use the System.in as input. Creates a new Scanner and uses a method chose
        Parameters:
        date - the date of initialization of the collection
        collection - the collection which we work with
        chapters - the chapters collection where all the chapters are stored
        file - the file where the collection is stored
        See Also:
        program.commands.Commands

      • program.commands.CommandReader

        public program.commands.CommandReader(java.util.Date date,
                     java.util.LinkedList<additionals.SpaceMarine> collection,
                     java.util.LinkedList<additionals.Chapter> chapters,
                     java.lang.String file,
                     java.lang.String script,
                     int marker)
        Constructor for instantiating a new Command reader to use the script-file as input. Creates a new Scanner and uses a method chose with anonymous program.commands.Commands inheritor with muted commands
        Parameters:
        date - the date of initialization of the collection
        collection - the collection which we work with
        chapters - the chapters collection where all the chapters are stored
        file - the file where the collection is stored
        script - the script-file where we want to read the commands from
        marker - the marker that helps us to know if we are reading from script-file (marker>=1) or from System.in (marker=0).
        See Also:
        program.commands.Commands

    • Method Detail

      • chose

        public void chose(program.commands.Commands commands,
                  java.util.Scanner scn,
                  java.util.LinkedList<additionals.SpaceMarine> collection,
                  java.util.LinkedList<additionals.Chapter> chapters,
                  java.util.Date date,
                  java.lang.String file,
                  int marker)
        Method for reading the input and parsing the Strings into commands
        Parameters:
        commands - the class which contains methods for all the commands
        scn - the Scanner tuned with constructor to read from System.in or from script-file
        collection - the collection which we work with
        chapters - the chapters collection where all the chapters are stored
        date - the date of initialization of the collection
        file - the file where the collection is stored
        marker - the marker that helps us to know if we are reading from script-file (marker>=1) or from System.in (marker=0).
